item.title: Learning Seminar On Mirror Theory
item.author: hussainmkj@gmail.com (Hussain Kadhem)
item.description: We are running an online learning seminar at the University of Toronto on mirror symmetry, aimed at undergraduate students. organization The seminar is being led by Waleed Qaisar. We meet every Monday at 10:30 am on zoom. If you would like to join, then please contact Waleed for the meeting password. Outline We will start by following this Clay monograph by Hori et al. The initial aim will be to finish Part 2 as quickly as possible, but not quicker.

item.title: About Me
item.author: hussainmkj@gmail.com (Hussain Kadhem)
item.description: I am a compiler developer at the IBM Toronto software lab. I am in my final year of undergraduate studies in math at the University of Toronto. My Work I have been employed as a software developer at IBM since June 2019], where I work on the open-source LLVM compiler project. My work has spanned the areas of loop optimization, loop vectorization, register allocation, and PowerPC enablement. Previously, I did compiler development as an intern in the [Nvidia] Linux graphics team, and contract work in high-performance computing and numerical linear algebra.
